initializer.declarationSourceEnd = braceEnd < initializer.declarationSourceStart ? initializer.declarationSourceStart : braceEnd;
solves the problem but errors reported are not accurate, investigating how to get that right.

Bug in comment 6 looks different and I think it should be fixed in the ASTConverter. In org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.ASTConverter.setTypeAnnotationsAndSourceRangeOnArray(ArrayType, Annotation[][]) line 3419
int end = retrieveProperRightBracketPosition(dimensions.size(), endElement);
the endElement is the position of the right bracket and hence we cannot find right bracket position from there. Using 'start' there solves the problem but breaks something else. Will create a new bug for that
